It is a terrestrial plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky substrates in South Africa. The plant has a thalloid structure with a distinct, leafy appearance, and its leaves are arranged in a dense, cushion-like formation. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
